CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 20, 1972, pg. 19 reads: "Black Solidarity Fair - "What Time Is It....Nation Time!" - photos by Harris." Cutline of article published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 6, 1972, pg. 33 reads: " 'Black Solidarity Week' Proclaimed - Mayor Peter Flaherty has proclaimed May 1 through 4 "Black SOlidarity Week" in City of Pittsburgh...The sponsoring organizations of the Black Solidarity Fair are the Hill Cultural Center, headed by Ed Ellis, and the United Black Front, headed by Clyde Jackson.  Chairman of the Executive Committee is Nate Smith."
TitMainTitle: Two women, including one wearing polka dot bodysuit, standing with New Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper van in display, during Black Solidarity Fair, Civic Arena
CatSubject_tab: New Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Civic Arena (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
